verses.verse: Thankfulness for Spiritual Attainments Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus (Lit through) by the will of God, and Timothy (Lit the) our brother,
To the (Lit holy ones; i. e., God’s people) saints and faithful brothers and sisters in Christ who are at Colossae: Grace to you and peace from God our Father.
We (Or always give... praying for you) give thanks to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and the love which you have (Or toward) for all the (Lit holy ones; i. e., God’s people) saints;
because of the hope reserved for you in (Lit the heavens) heaven, of which you previously heard in the word of truth, (Or of the gospel) the gospel

which has come to you, just as (Or it is in all the world also, bearing) in all the world also it is bearing fruit and (Or spreading abroad) increasing, even as it has been doing in you also since the day you heard it and (Or came to fully know) understood the grace of God in truth;
just as you learned it from Epaphras, our beloved fellow bond-servant, who is a faithful servant of Christ on our behalf,
and he also informed us of your love in the Spirit.

For this reason we also, since the day we heard about it, have not ceased praying for you and asking that you may be filled with the (Or real knowledge) knowledge of His will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,

so that you will walk in a manner worthy of the Lord, (Lit unto all pleasing) to please Him in all respects, bearing fruit in every good work and (Or growing by the knowledge) increasing in the (Or real knowledge) knowledge of God;
strengthened with all power, according to (Lit the might of His glory) His glorious might, (Lit unto all) for the attaining of all perseverance and (Or patience with joy) patience; joyously
giving thanks to the Father, who has qualified us (Lit unto the portion of) to share in the inheritance of the (Lit holy ones; i. e., God’s people) saints in light.
The Incomparable Christ (Lit Who rescued) For He rescued us from the (Lit authority) domain of darkness, and transferred us to the kingdom of (Lit the Son of His love) His beloved Son,
in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.
(Lit Who is) He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation:

for (Or in) by Him all things were created, both in the heavens and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones, or dominions, or rulers, or authorities—all things have been created through Him and for Him.
He (Or has existed prior to) is before all things, and in Him all things (Or endure) hold together.
He is also the head of the body, the church; and He is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, so that He Himself will come to have first place in everything.
For (Or all the fullness was pleased to dwell) it was the Father’s good pleasure for all the (I. e., fullness of deity) fullness to dwell in Him,
and through Him to reconcile all things to Himself, whether things on earth or things in (Lit the heavens) heaven, having made peace through the blood of His cross.
And although you were previously alienated and hostile in attitude, engaged in evil deeds,
yet He has now reconciled you in His body of flesh through death, in order to present you before Him holy and blameless and beyond reproach—

if indeed you continue in (Or in faith) the faith firmly established and steadfast, and not shifting from the hope of the gospel that you have heard, which was proclaimed in all creation under heaven, and of which I, Paul, (Lit became) was made a (Or servant) minister.
Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and in my flesh I am supplementing what is lacking (Lit of) in Christ’s afflictions in behalf of His body, which is the church.

I (Lit became) was made a minister of this church according to the commission from God granted to me for your benefit, so that I might (Lit make full the word of God) fully carry out the preaching of the word of God,
that is, the mystery which had been hidden from the past ages and generations, but now has been revealed to His (Lit holy ones; i. e., God’s people) saints,
to whom God willed to make known what the wealth of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles is, the mystery that is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
We proclaim Him, admonishing every person and teaching every person (Lit in) with all wisdom, so that we may present every person (Or perfect) complete in Christ.
For this purpose I also labor, striving according to His (Lit working) power which (Lit in power) works mightily within me.
